Using 1.2.2. x64, Windows 10.

I can set my joystick controls alright, except KSP does not recognize my joystick's rudder and throttle axis. Other axis' are working well (finally!).

My joystick controller is Arduino Pro Micro.

In other games and in windows control panel joystick settings the axes are working well.

I think it's axis 1.2.

 

I found a workaround to set the potentiometer to use axis called "Y-axis" instead of throttle/rudder, but the problem persists, there's two axes that I can't use.

 

My TM HOTAS 4 works perfectly in KSP.

Does Windows itself recognise your controller?
In other words, does the Arduino advertise all the axes properly?
Yep. I can set up the pot to use any axis and all are working properly.
